item.title: Reflections on God 7: Current Beliefs
item.description: This is part of God Flux but split into smaller sections for an easier read. Views on other beliefs I retain a relatively moderate view on people who take an external god literally, so long as they never cross the line of violence especially with children, nature or other cultures.

item.title: Reflections on God 6: Radical Atheism
item.description: This is part of God Flux but split into smaller sections for an easier read. Radical Atheism After almost a year of intense email exchanges about god with my friend in Sydney, I went to Edinburgh for my Masters in Neuroscience.

item.title: Reflections on God 5: Yoga
item.description: This is part of God Flux but split into smaller sections for an easier read. Yoga I took up Yoga classes in the holidays between my BSc and MSc mainly to address a back problem I had developed by using a tilted chair.

item.title: Reflections on God 4: Hindu Mythology and Philosophy
item.description: This is part of God Flux but split into smaller sections for an easier read. Ka, Doniger, Joseph Campbell Before entering the waters of atheism again, let me mention the other influences I had during and a little after my undergraduate years.

item.title: Reflections on God 3: The Other Cheek of Christianity
item.description: This is part of God Flux but split into smaller sections for an easier read. The other cheek of Christianity During my undergraduate course, I joined the choir and sang songs praising Jesus.

item.title: Reflections on God 2: Deep Ecology and Buddhism
item.description: This is part of God Flux but written in smaller sections for an easier read. Compassion So I put together my own version of god. Almost an imaginary friend.

item.title: Reflections on God 1: Childhood Atheism and Introduction to Kabir Poetry
item.description: This is part of God Flux but written in smaller sections for an easier read. Basic Atheism As a child I was taught to worship Hindu gods in temples and during Poojas (auspicious days/festivals) at home.

item.title: God Flux; Reflection on a Spiritual Journey
item.description: I have wondered about the concept of god all my life so far. I would like to describe and reflect on my journey so far.

item.title: Kanmani Anbodu Kadhalan: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a song in which Kamal plays an illiterate man in love. He wanted to write a letter to his sweetheart and asks help to make it sound poetic.

item.title: Vasantha Kala Nadigalile: Feature Spoiler
item.description: Talk about twisted! Rajani is a true villian in this song. You must watch the video to understand why, though the audio alone should also suffice.

item.title: Ennadi Meenakshi- Lyrics and Translation
item.description: Theme Betrayal! The beat is peppy, but the song conveys his pain. It is almost caustically sarcastic in some parts. Kamal’s character is singing to the girl who left him for his friend.

item.title: Swasame – Lyrics and Translation
item.description: From Thenali, another Kamal Movie (:)), this clip starts with her singing to him and he tells her that it would be better to sing a duet in their dreams (unobserved by street people) so they can change location and clothes as they please (as it typical of movie songs).

item.title: Athisaya Raagam Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This raagam, called Mahati, has only 4 notes. In Karnatic music, all raagams have either 5, 6 or 7 notes. But Balamurali Krishna invented this one and was critisised for his non-traditional innovation.

item.title: Kanne Kalaimaane Lyrics and Translation
item.description: In this song, Kamal’s character is singing to Sridevi’s character. The story of Moondraam Pirai is about a troubled young man who finds a mentally ill girl about to be sold for the first time in a brothal.

item.title: Thakita Thadimi (Salangai Oli) Lyrics Translated
item.description: I recommend this beautiful movie to everyone. In this song, the uber-talented dancer has become an alcoholic and he sings and dances referring to the past he shares with the widow who is watching him.

item.title: Anbe Sivam Lyrics Translation
item.description: The movie this song is from is also called Anbe Sivam. It is one of Kamal Hassan´s most poignant movies and I recommend it to everyone if they can find it with subtitles.
